comments.text:
SeaMonkey 2.4.1 is displaying incorrect header information. 

With the 32-bit Linux version, what should be listed as the User-Agent header, it is intermittently displaying an incorrect header instead:

In the GUI with all headers displayed, I have seen the headers display:

x-mimeole: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux i686; rv:7.0.1) Gecko/20110928 Firefox/7.0.1 SeaMonkey/2.4.1

and

x-mailer: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux i686; rv:7.0.1) Gecko/20110928 Firefox/7.0.1 SeaMonkey/2.4.1

on e-mails sent via IMAP accounts.  The "x" in both of these headers, is not capitalized.

Instead it should be displaying:

User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux i686; rv:7.0.1) Gecko/20110928 Firefox/7.0.1 SeaMonkey/2.4.1

I also use the 64-bit Linux contributed build of SeaMonkey and also the Windows release, but have not yet noticed the same issue with these two.  If I also see this with those versions, I will add that to the bug report.

I do not see such an option.  With POP3 mailboxes, there is an option "Repair Folder" though, if this is what you are referring to, but this oddity was noticed with both POP3 and IMAP messages.  This option is not shown for IMAP folders.

I have since checked SM 2.4.1 for Windows and the Linux x86_64 contributed build and this issue did not occur with either.

But the upgrade process mentioned in Comment 2 appears to have corrected it.
